intro: Trigonotis funingensis, commonly known as the Funing trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement, often with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
